remarks: If the center of the point inversion ` A ` is between two points ` X ` and ` Y ` , then the half lines are mirrored.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 3-Mar-2020.)
statement:
mirval.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
mirval.d $e |- .- = ( dist ` G ) $.
mirval.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
mirval.l $e |- L = ( LineG ` G ) $.
mirval.s $e |- S = ( pInvG ` G ) $.
mirval.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
mirhl.m $e |- M = ( S ` A ) $.
mirhl.k $e |- K = ( c e. P |-> { <. a , b >. | ( ( a e. P /\ b e. P ) /\ ( a =/= c /\ b =/= c /\ ( a e. ( c I b ) \/ b e. ( c I a ) ) ) ) } ) $.
mirhl.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. P ) $.
mirhl.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. P ) $.
mirhl.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. P ) $.
mirhl.z $e |- ( ph -> Z e. P ) $.
mirbtwnhl.1 $e |- ( ph -> X =/= A ) $.
mirbtwnhl.2 $e |- ( ph -> Y =/= A ) $.
mirbtwnhl.3 $e |- ( ph -> A e. ( X I Y ) ) $.
mirbtwnhl $p |- ( ph -> ( Z ( K ` A ) X <-> ( M ` Z ) ( K ` A ) Y ) ) $.
$d A a b c $.
$d I a b c $.
$d M a b c $.
$d P a b c $.
$d X a b $.
$d Y a b $.
$d Z a b c $.
